overview:
Coach Rob Williams

Over the course of his career, each position Coach Rob Williams has held has had one thing in common: basketball. He’s worked as a coach and instructor for a wide range of levels, from high school to college. When not coaching, Williams can often be found in the classroom, teaching a diverse range of subjects from physical education to driver’s education.

Coach Rob Williams loves sports. He loves sports so much that he earned not one, but two degrees in sports related fields. His first degree is a bachelor of science in sports management from Florida State University. He then went on to earn a masters degree in sports administration from the US Sports Academy, a school whose primary focus is providing graduate degrees in sports fields.

Williams got his start coaching early. As a player and student at Gulf Coast Community College, he also served as the assistant basketball coach. Rob Williams was one of the team’s shining stars at Gulf Coast. He earned the title of Defensive Player of the Year in 1991. In 1992, he helped the team set a record for most points scored in a game.

Coach Rob Williams has had a lasting impact on the basketball teams he coached at the high school level. He’s worked as a basketball coach in Georgia and Florida. From 2007 to 2008, Williams was the head coach for the boy’s basketball team at Ware County High School in Georgia. While he was coach, the team had an 18 to 10 record.

Williams wasn’t only the coach at Ware County High School. He also served as the school’s driver education teacher and first aid teacher. Through his various positions at the high school, Williams was able to teach students several important life lessons, from how to bandage a wound to how to drive a car.

Coach Rob Williams is also in demand as a basketball coach at the community college level. He’s worked with teams at several colleges, from North Florida University to Alabama Southern Community College. Each team did well and set records while Williams was at the helm.
